Articles.Content: This is a challenge in which you build a payload rocket and get it\'s payload to orbit. The payloads can be space stations satellites, anything! Also please post you craft file and what mods you used.
I do this on a daily basis in KSP.

nice backround on your mac

lol he asks for your rocket, the only thing you do is looking at his background =P
This one gets really in orbit and its so big!

Attached is my fave at the moment, gets a 28 tank 3 stage rocket into orbit without tapping any of its fuel- has the unhealthy habit of occasionally leaving some rockets behind on the pad though :\'(

The normal XPB is a \'safe\' version

Attached is my fave at the moment, gets a 28 tank 3 stage rocket into orbit without tapping any of its fuel- has the unhealthy habit of occasionally leaving some rockets behind on the pad though :\'(

The normal XPB is a \'safe\' version

pictures?
If i tried to advertise it to you, it would be verging on spacecraft exchange material.

I present MELLISSA, SKRAM\'s Advanced Super Heavy Lifter. [sTOCK no Mods]

Capable of getting 121 Full fuel tanks out to 200,000m @ 27% efficiency by weight.

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=10468.0

Attached is my fave at the moment, gets a 28 tank 3 stage rocket into orbit without tapping any of its fuel- has the unhealthy habit of occasionally leaving some rockets behind on the pad though :\'(

The normal XPB is a \'safe\' version

Nice, love the staging, even if this dose seem to fall apart a lot on load maybe I should try the safe version, but that doesnt sound very Kerbal to me!
New rule. You MUST provide a picture.
